subject: RE: [junit] Print complex datatypes(hash table, Vectors)
msgSnippet: Approach 1) Add logging to your test case to print the values right before the assert* method call. Approach 2) Wrap JUnit with your own assert* methods that
messageBody:
Approach 1) Add logging to your test case to print the values right
before the assert* method call.

Approach 2) Wrap JUnit with your own assert* methods that print out
whatever you like when a failure happens.


Todd.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Bala Krishna Kunam [mailto:bkkunam@...]
> Sent: Saturday, March 19, 2005 6:11 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Print complex datatypes(hash table, Vectors)
>
>
>
> Hi,
>
> Whenever assert* or and JUnit test call fails or behaves
> unexpectedly, We need to dump the input/output, so that user
> can see why it failed or What happened? In case of complex
> data types like Vector or Hash Table, we need to device a way
> to dump it as well.This should happen whether we run it from
> command line or from IDE like Eclipse. Can you please help us
> to find the solution to print the values.
> Thanks & Regards,
> Bala
